summary: The Freedom of Association in Higher Education Act of 2025 seeks to protect the rights of students in single-sex social organizations. It amends the Higher Education Act of 1965 to prevent institutions from taking adverse actions against students or organizations based on single-sex membership practices. The bill clarifies permissible actions for institutions, defines key terms, and aims to ensure students can freely associate with and participate in social organizations, including single-sex fraternities and sororities.
